amaranth.name: Amaranth
amaranth.nutrition: Rich in Vitamins A, C, E, and K. High in Calcium and Iron.
amaranth.care: Avoid overwatering. Keep blackout weighted to improve stem strength. No soak required.
amaranth.pros: Suitable for all soil types. Fast grower.
amaranth.fert: Low nitrogen bio-stimulant on Day 5 to boost betacyanin (pigment) levels.
amaranth.tips: Extremely sensitive to overwatering; use fine mist only. Keep blackout weighted to improve stem strength. Do NOT soak.

radish.name: Radish
radish.nutrition: Rich in enzymes and antioxidants that aid digestion.
radish.care: Grows fast, monitor from Day 5. Harvest early for a spicy kick.
radish.cons: Prone to root rot if overwatered.
radish.fert: Liquid seaweed extract on Day 3 for rapid root development.
radish.tips: Grows aggressively; monitor closely from Day 5. Harvesting early preserves the spicy 'kick'. No soak.

broccoli.name: Broccoli
broccoli.nutrition: Rich in Sulforaphane, which has anti-cancer properties.
broccoli.care: High light intensity required. Harvest at first true leaf.
broccoli.fert: Balanced ocean-based fertilizer at 25% strength after Day 4.
broccoli.tips: High light intensity required; 16-18 hours of LED light prevents leggy stems. Harvest at first true leaf. No soak.

pea-shoots.name: Pea Shoots
pea-shoots.nutrition: High in protein and Vitamins A, C.
pea-shoots.care: Soak for 8-12 hours. Use heavy weight for strong roots.
pea-shoots.fert: Rich compost tea in the soaking water. Usually self-sufficient after that.
pea-shoots.tips: SOAK 8-12h. Weight heavily (2-4 kg) for 3-4 days to ensure strong root penetration. Harvest as tendrils appear.

sunflower.name: Sunflower
sunflower.nutrition: Rich in healthy fats and protein.
sunflower.care: Soak for 8-12 hours. Use cover to help hulls shed easily.
sunflower.cons: Seed hulls can be hard to remove.
sunflower.fert: Calcium-Magnesium supplement on Day 4 to assist with seed hull shedding.
sunflower.tips: SOAK 8-12h. Stack trays during blackout to force hulls off. Mist hulls daily to keep them soft for shedding.

beetroot.name: Beetroot
beetroot.nutrition: Rich in nitrates that help improve blood flow.
beetroot.care: Soak for 8-12 hours. Sow with space as seeds are clusters.
beetroot.pros: Beautiful red color, great for salads.
beetroot.fert: Boron-enriched water on Day 5 prevents 'black heart' in larger harvests.
beetroot.tips: Seeds are actually multi-germ clusters; sow slightly thinner. Soak 8-12 hours in tepid water.

red-amaranthus.name: Red Amaranth
red-amaranthus.nutrition: High iron, vitamin C, antioxidants; anti-anemia, heart health.
red-amaranthus.care: Suggested soaking: No Soak. Sprout time: 2.5 days. Growth time: 12.0 days.
red-amaranthus.pros: Anemia-prone, vegans; boosts energy. Great for garnishing.
red-amaranthus.cons: Oxalates may affect kidney stones if overconsumed.
red-amaranthus.fert: Low nitrogen bio-stimulant on Day 5 to boost betacyanin (pigment) levels.
red-amaranthus.tips: Extremely sensitive to overwatering; use fine mist only. Keep blackout weighted to improve stem strength. Do NOT soak.
